statement.tex: \text{if }y = \cos^{-1} x,\text{Find }\dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2}\text{ in terms of y alone.}

step.context: \text{Which of the following matches your}\\ \text{understanding of }\dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2}?
step.reason: \dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2} \text{ is the derivative of the derivative }\\ \text{of y.}
\dfrac{dy}{dx} = -\csc y \text{ is more relevant to the question}\\ \text{as we have to find $\dfrac{dy}{dx}$ in terms of y}.

step.tex:
\dfrac{dy}{dx} = -\csc y\\
\text{Diffrentiating the above equation we get}\\ \begin{align} \dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2} &= -\dfrac{d(\csc y)}{dx}\\ &= - (-\csc y \cot y . \dfrac{dy}{dx})\\ &= \csc y \cot y .\dfrac{dy}{dx}\\ &= \csc y .\cot y .(-\csc y)\\ &= -\cot y .\csc^2 y\\ \end{align}
